text: there are almost 200 productions in this
year's New York International Fringe
Festival and with so many shows out
there one of the challenges for any
theatre company is how do you make your
show stand out from the crowd there are
social media there's go to win a mouth
has good reviews and there's one more
way a little more old-school a postcard
I've noticed that over the past few
years the postcard designs for fringe
festival shows have actually gotten to
be quite beautiful the best are artworks
in and of themselves
I think the more savvy theater companies
realize that just with a little more
effort and Photoshop they can come up
with a postcard that'll really make
their ships than that but don't forget a
good post card does not mean it's going
to translate into a good show never
judge a book by it's cover and never
judge a show by the Coast Guard
